simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Message type identifier composed of:
One digit version number
Three digit message identifier

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The Primary Account Number (PAN) contains the account number used to identify a customer account or relationship and remains unchanged for the life of a transaction.
If this field is not present and the message contains data element 35, the system will obtain the primary account by parsing the track-two data contained there.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
The processing code (also called pcode in this documentation) is a constructed data element composed of three subfields:
Transaction Type Code, AN2
Account Type Code 1, AN2
Account Type Code 2, AN2
The Transaction Type Code (TTC) is used along with the Message Type Indicator (MTI) as a key to uniquely identify the type of transaction being processed.

row.entry: Reversal - use same code as original (See )

simplesect.para: The Transaction type code describes the specific transaction type. The Account type Code 1 describes the account type affected for debits and inquiries and the "from" account for transfers. The Account type Code 2 describes the account type affected for credits and the "to" account for transfers.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Transaction amount is a constructed data element of three parts totalling 16 positions:

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Transaction amount is a constructed data element of three parts totalling 16 positions:

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: If transaction fee(s) and/or currency conversion is involved in the transaction, &PRODUCTNAME; uses this data element to represent the actual amount billed to the cardholder.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Date and time the message initiator sends this message expressed in UTC (MMDDhhmmss).

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: If a transaction fee is involved, &PRODUCTNAME; uses this data element to represent the actual fee amount.

note.para: DE 006 () contains the total amount including this fee.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Contains the conversion rate used for settlement purposes, formatted as ABBBBBBB. It is used when the transaction currency is different from the settlement currency.
A: single digit represents the position of the decimal point, counted from the right.
BBBBBBB: seven digits that represent the conversion factor.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Contains the conversion rate used for billing the cardholder, formatted as ABBBBBBB. It is used when the transaction currency is different from the cardholder billing currency.
A: single digit represents the position of the decimal point, counted from the right.
BBBBBBB: seven digits that represent the conversion factor.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Unique sequence number used to match a request/response pair.

sect1.title: DE-012 Date and time local transaction

indexterm.secondary: DE 012, Date and time local transaction

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Date and time local transaction in CCYYMMDDhhmmss format providing the local year, month, day and time in which the transaction takes place at the card acceptor location.
This field remains unchanged throughout the lifetime of the transaction.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Effective card date in CCYYMM format.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Expiration date of the card. It must be present whenever the acceptor does not automatically capture either the track2 or track1. The expiration date should represent the date after which the card has to be flagged as expired and the transaction declined.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Settlement date in CCYYMMDD format.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: &PRODUCTNAME; capture date in MMDD format.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The message error indicator is a constructed data element of up to ten sets of values. Each set of values defines a single error condition and consists of six parts totalling 14 positions:

listitem.para: Data sub-element in error (in constructed data element), N2
Dataset identifier in error (in composite data element), B1
Data bit or tag in error (in composite data element), B2

simplesect.para: The error severity code contains a value of 00 (zero zero) to denote a rejected message or 01 to denote a message that was accepted and processed but contained invalid data in non-critical elements (00=error, 01=warning).
The message error code contains a code identifying the error condition as described in the following table:
The data element in error contains the data element number (001-128) and same goes for data sub-element, data set, bit or tag.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: A code identifying the country of the acquiring institution.

sect1.title: DE-021 Transaction life cycle identification data

indexterm.secondary: DE 021, Transaction life cycle identification data

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
The Transaction life cycle identification data is a constructed data element of four parts totalling 22 positions:
Life cycle support indicator, AN 1
Life cycle trace identifier, AN 15
Life cycle transaction sequence number, N2
Life cycle authentication token, N4

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Indicates the method used to capture the PAN as well as the terminal's capabilities.

This is a constructed data element composed of four 32-bit elements (four bytes each) indicating:
Card reading method used at POS
Cardholder verification method used at POS
POS environment
Security characteristics
simplesect.table: Card reading method used at POS &pdc_rm_rc_low;
Card reading method used at POS (Bits 17 to 32) &pdc_rm_rc_high;
simplesect.para: The following table lists the value attributed to each bit of the 32 bits (four bytes) which indicate the cardholder verification method actually used by the POS.
simplesect.table: Cardholder verification method used at POS &pdc_vm_vc_low;

note.para: Bits 17 to 32 are reserved for ISO, National and Private use and not currently used by &PRODUCTNAME;.

simplesect.para: The following table lists the value attributed to each bit of the 32 bits (four bytes) which indicate the POS environment.

note.para: Bits 17 to 32 are reserved for ISO, National and Private use and not currently used by &PRODUCTNAME;.

simplesect.para: The following table lists the value attributed to each bit of the 32 bits (four bytes) which indicate the security characteristics.

note.para: Bits 17 to 32 are reserved for ISO, National and Private use and not currently used by &PRODUCTNAME;.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: A number distinguishing between separate cards with the same primary account number.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: A code indicating the specific purpose of a message within its message class. provides a list of function codes values supported by &PRODUCTNAME;

simplesect.title: Description
Description
simplesect.para: Code classifying the type of business being done by the card acceptor for this transaction. See .

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Provides information about POS card reading and cardholder verification capabilities, approval code and PIN input length, cardholder and card acceptor receipt and display length, ICC scripts length, track 3 rewrite and card capture capability.
The following table lists the value attributed to each bit of the 32 bits (four bytes) which indicate the cardholder verification capabilities supported by the POS.

note.para: Bits 17 to 32 are reserved for ISO, National and Private use and not currently used by &PRODUCTNAME;.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Amounts original is a constructed data element of two parts totalling 32 positions.
Each 16-positions part is in turn a constructed data element of three parts:

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: A code identifying the acquirer.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: A code identifying the forwarding institution.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The Electronic commerce data field is a composite data element containing information related to 3D-Secure transactions and other e-commerce related details.

table.title: DE 34 subfields — Authentication data — Dataset identifier 73
DE 34 subfields — Additional data — Dataset identifier 74

row.entry: Secure temporary storage, POS device capable

table.title: DE 34 subfields — Additional service request data — Dataset identifier 75
DE 34 subfields — Additional service result data — Dataset identifier 76
DE 34 subfields — Terminal information — Dataset identifier 77

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
The information encoded on the Track 2 of the magnetic stripe
See ISO-7813 including field separators and excluding the start sentinel, end sentinel and longitudinal redundancy check (LRC) characters.
This is a compound field consisting of the following elements:

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Alphanumeric code assigned by &PRODUCTNAME; in order to uniquely identify a transaction. This code remains unchanged throughout the life of the transaction.
Although this field is called Retrieval Reference "Number", please note this is an alphanumeric field that may contain regular characters.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Approval Code assigned by &PRODUCTNAME; when the transaction is approved (see DE 039).

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Result Code (also called Action Code in ISO-8583v2003/2023) returned by &PRODUCTNAME; to indicate whether the transaction is approved or declined. provides a list of result codes supported by &PRODUCTNAME;.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: A code used to uniquely identify the terminal originating a transaction; this code is also referred to as the Terminal Identifier or 'TID.'

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: A code used to uniquely identify the card acceptor originating a transaction; this code is also referrred to as the Merchant Identifier or 'MID.'

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The name and location of the card acceptor as known to the cardholder. This is a constructed data field containing:

row.entry: Bit 5, Card acceptor state, province or region code
Bit 9, Card acceptor customer service phone number
Bit 10, Card acceptor additional contact information

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
The information encoded on the Track 1 of the magnetic stripe
See ISO-7813 including field separators and excluding the start sentinel, end sentinel and longitudinal redundancy check ('LRC') characters.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Fees associated with this transaction. This is a constructed data element composed of up to six sets of 36-digit values. Each set of values shall consist of four parts.

entry.para:
N2
00 Transaction fee
02 Fee Collection Fee
07 Card Acceptor Service fee

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The verification data data element is a composite data element containing additional data used to support the identification of someone (e.g. cardholder) or something (e.g. account existence) through the use of address verification, account verification or other identification such as a national ID, driver's license, CVV2, CVC2, 4DBC, etc.).
The following table lists the subelements that may appear in the request.
The following table lists the subelements that may appear in the response.

row.entry: Card Verification Value for Card not present
Card Verification Value for Card present

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: PIN related data in ISO 9564-1 format used to identify the cardholder

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This field contains the card's security code as printed in the [front/back] of the card (zero-padded, right-justified).
This security code is a 3- or 4- digit value printed on the card or signature strip, but not encoded on the magnetic stripe.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This is a constructed data element composed of up to six 21-digit amounts.

entry.para:
N2
01 Account ledger/current balance
02 Account available balance
07 Destination Account ledger balance
08 Destination Account available balance
20 Amount remaining this cycle.
40 Amount cash.
42 Amount surcharge.
80 Gratuity.
81 Amount taxed.

row.entry: A1 - C for Credit, D for Debit

sect1.title: DE-055 Integrated Circuit Card (ICC) Related Data

indexterm.secondary: DE 055, Integrated Circuit Card (ICC) Related Data

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This field contains integrated circuit card (ICC) related data in an ISO 7816-6 TLV coding structure.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Key data elements contained in the original message. Provided in reversal transactions. This is a constructed data element composed of four sub elements:
Original Protocol version and Message Type Identifier (MTI), N4
See:
Original System Trace Audit Number (STAN), N12
See:
Original Date and Time Local Transaction in UTC (CCYYMMDDhhmmss), N14
See:
Original Acquiring Institution Identification Code, N..11
See:

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Contains data from the originator of the message that shall be returned unaltered in a response message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Display message associated with the result code (see ) for the locale name specified in the request.
locale names are defined at &PRODUCTNAME; configuration time.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Used in settlement message to transmit the terminal's batch number.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This data element is a constructed data element of two parts.

listitem.para: Indicates the total number of notification or instruction messages to be transmitted for this batch.
Provides the unique identifier assigned to the batch.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Other data required to be passed to support an administrative or file action message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Number and amount values required to complete the reconciliation of financial totals. This is a constructed data element composed of 6 amount/counter pairs

sect1.title: DE-093 Transaction destination institution identification code

indexterm.secondary: DE 093, Transaction destination institution identification code

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: A code identifying the Transaction destination institution.

sect1.title: DE-094 Transaction originator institution identification code

indexterm.secondary: DE 094, Transaction originator institution identification code

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: A code identifying the Transaction originator institution identification.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This field contains the corrected amounts of an authorization transaction. This field has 3 subfields:
Each subfield has 16-positions, each a data element constructed of three parts:

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The net value (in the indicated currenncy) of all gross amounts. Net reconciliation amount is a constructed data element of three parts totalling 21 positions:

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: A code identifying the settlement institution.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: A code identifying the receiving institution.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: While on file update messages this field containes the actual or abbreviated name of the file being accessed by the transaction, on regular authorization/financial transactions, it may contain a transaction modifier.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Used to reference a source account in a transfer transaction.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Used to reference a destination account in a transfer transaction.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Optional user field to be echoed back by the &PRODUCTNAME; based system.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Optional user field to be handled by the &PRODUCTNAME; based system and transmitted to Destination Stations

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: TPP use data element 113 to hold application specific data elements. See for details.

simplesect.title: Data Element: 114
simplesect.para: Reserved for private use

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Reserved for application-specific, customer private use.

simplesect.title: Data Element: 115
simplesect.para: Reserved for private use

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Reserved for application-specific, customer private use.

sect1.title: DE-116 Reserved for national use
sect1.para: This data element, reserved for national use, depends on the content of , which specifies the acquiring institution's country code.

simplesect.title: Data Element: 116
simplesect.para: Reserved for national use

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Reserved for national use.

sect2.title: 032 - Argentina
sect2.para: When has the value 032, the ISO-3166 country code for Argentina, Field 116 may include:

listitem.para: 116.1 – CUIT/CUIL (AN11): The tax identification number for businesses (CUIT) or individuals (CUIL).
116.2 – VAT (IVA) Amount (N16): The value-added tax applied to the transaction.
116.3 – Perception Tax Amount (N16): An additional tax collected for specific industries or transactions.

sect2.title: 076 - Brazil
sect2.para: When has the value 076, the ISO-3166 country code for Brazil, Field 116 may include:

listitem.para: 116.1 – CPF/CNPJ (AN14): The tax identification number for individuals (CPF) or businesses (CNPJ).
116.2 – ISS Tax Amount (N16): The municipal tax applied to service transactions.
116.3 – ICMS Tax Amount (N16): The state tax applied to the sale of goods.

sect2.title: 356 - India
sect2.para: When has the value 356, the ISO-3166 country code for India, Field 116 may include:

listitem.para: 116.1 – GSTIN (AN15): The Goods and Services Tax Identification Number used for tax compliance.
116.2 – GST Amount (N16): The total tax applied under the Goods and Services Tax system.
116.3 – TDS Amount (N16): The Tax Deducted at Source (TDS) for applicable transactions.

sect2.title: 566 - Nigeria
sect2.para: When has the value 566, the ISO-3166 country code for Nigeria, Field 116 may include:

listitem.para: 116.1 – TIN (AN10): The Taxpayer Identification Number used for VAT and corporate tax compliance.
116.2 – VAT Amount (N16): The total Value-Added Tax applied to the transaction.
116.3 – Withholding Tax Amount (N16): The tax amount deducted at source for applicable transactions.

sect2.title: 724 - Spain
sect2.para: When has the value 724, the ISO-3166 country code for Spain, Field 116 may include:

listitem.para: 116.1 – NIF (AN9): The Spanish tax identification number for individuals and businesses.
116.2 – VAT (IVA) Amount (N16): The total VAT applied to the transaction.
116.3 – SII Reporting Indicator (N1): Identifies transactions that must be reported in Spain’s Immediate Supply of Information (SII) system.

sect2.title: 840 - USA
sect2.para: When has the value 840, the ISO-3166 country code for the United States, Field 116 may include tax-related or regulatory information such as:

listitem.para: 116.1 – Sales Tax Amount (N16): The total applicable sales tax for the transaction, based on state and local tax rates.
116.2 – Merchant Category Code (N4): The MCC assigned to the merchant for taxation and reporting.
116.3 – Tax Jurisdiction Code (AN10): Identifies the tax jurisdiction (state, county, or city) for proper tax reporting.

sect2.title: 858 - Uruguay
sect2.para: When has the value 858, the ISO-3166 country code for Uruguay, Field 116 has the following composite data elements:

listitem.para: 116.1 - Taxable Amount (N16): The portion of the original amount that is subject to applicable transaction taxes.
116.2 - Taxable Benefit Amount (N16): Amount to be subtracted from the original transaction total due to a tax benefit.
116.3 - Tax Benefit Points (N3): A numerical representation of tax benefits accrued from the transaction. This value may be used in specific tax-related incentive programs.
116.4 - Law Limit Reached (AN1): Indicates whether the transaction has reached a predefined tax benefit limit established by national regulations. Values may include 'Y' (Yes) or 'N' (No).
116.5 - Law Indicator (N1): Identifies the specific tax law or regulation under which the transaction qualifies for benefits. The assigned numeric code corresponds to predefined legal provisions.
116.6 - Law Description (AN..20): A brief textual description of the applicable tax law, providing additional context on the regulatory framework governing the transaction.

sect1.title: DE-123 Reserved for customer-specific use
sect1.para: This data element is designated for customer-specific use.

This field is defined as a binary field to allow for flexible configuration as a composite jPOS field. This structure enables customers to define their own subfields, which can be configured as inner fields within the composite element. By leveraging this approach, organizations can encapsulate multiple data points within a single field while maintaining a structured, hierarchical format that aligns with their specific business or regulatory requirements.

simplesect.title: Data Element: 123
simplesect.para: Reserved for customer-specific use

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Reserved for customer-specific use.
